intro: Commiphora murraywatsonii, commonly known as the Murray Watson's myrrh, is a flowering plant species native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and produces a resin that is used in traditional medicine. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. The botanical features of this species make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
